instructions: Tap the Phone app to launch it. If you're already in the app and just listened to a voicemail, skip to Step 3. Tap the Voicemail button in the lower-right corner of the screen. Find the voicemail you want to delete. Tap it once to reveal the options or swipe right to left to reveal the Delete button. Tap Delete to remove the voicemail.
On the Voicemail screen, tap Edit . Tap each voicemail you want to delete. You'll know it's selected because it's marked with a blue check mark. Tap Delete and the selected voicemails are removed.

Tap the Phone icon. Tap the Voicemail icon. If you have deleted messages that haven t cleared, go to the Visual Voicemail list and tap Deleted Messages . Tap Clear All to permanently delete the messages listed there.
Go to the Voicemail screen and tap Deleted Messages . Tap the voicemail you want to undelete. Tap Undelete to return it to the Voicemail screen.

craig November 3, 2012 at 5:29 pm It is easy. You have to pause the movie downloads, go into Edit/Preferences/General. Uncheck Sources/Movies. Go and delete the downloads that you paused. I simply cannot afford the bandwidth, as my ISP has already reduced me twice. Alex Perkins October 8, 2012 at 5:51 pm Pull the plug!! How to remove expired rental movies from your iPhone or iPad http://matthewman.net/2011/09/14/remove-expired-rental-movies-iphone/ 1)Connect your iPhone to your computer 2)Check Manual Sync option 3)Expand iPhone's folder tree, go to Movies 4)Manually delete expired rental movie files 5)Uncheck Manual Sync option and resync Douglas Mutay October 31, 2012 at 2:09 pm That's the way to go!
